sub_title: Student in social history, gender, European politics and equal rights.
summary: My name is Saramijn, an enthusiastic and curious history student at Leiden University. I have a wide range of interests, although my primary focus is on social history, including women's and LGBTI+ history. In addition, I like to focus on European politics, about which I not only followed a minor, but for which I also worked in various positions within the European interdisciplinary student forum AEGEE. Within this forum I focused on topics such as Equal Rights, Civic Education and intercultural exchange in a broader sense of the word. I would describe myself as open-minded, creative and inventive, and I like to express these qualities in my work, study and hobbies. I can work independently, but I also have a lot of experience in working in and managing teams.

certifications.name: Propedeuse Geschiedenis
certifications.authority: Universiteit Leiden - Faculty of Governance and Global Affairs

company.name: Leiden University - Faculty of Governance and Global Affairs

profile_positions.description:
The Network Commission is an body of AEGEE, consisting of up to ten elected members. Its primary tasks are to ensure the smooth functioning of the AEGEE locals that form the Network and to enhance the internal communication both within the Network itself and between the Network and AEGEE-Europe. Each Network Commissioner acts in the interest of the Network as a whole, is a trusted source of information, and gives the best example of an active AEGEE member. They help develop and sustain the network and must remain up-to-date on the status of the network.

Each Network Commission has an area of AEGEE locals that they are responsible for. They work with their team of Subcommissioners to ensure the wellbeing of their locals and to support and educate them on necessary topics (i.e. teambuilding, communication, recruitment, etc.).

The Network Commissioner is also responsible for organising a Network Meeting where AEGEE members come together to learn about different topics connected with the work of AEGEE. Network Meetings consist of a variety of activities such as sharing best practisces, workshops on e.g. project management, public relations, fundraising, presentation skills, and discussions concerning current youth issues. The Network Commission is responsible for creating the program, arranging speakers and the content of the Network Meeting as a whole.
profile_positions.title: Network Commissioner

profile_positions.description:
The Equal Rights Working Group aims to acknowledge and tackle discrimination based on gender identity, expression and sexual orientation through raising awareness and non-formal education. It creates workshops and other materials to help educate on this topic and to raise awareness.

The coordinator is in charge of the Working Group and motivates the members to create and implement activities contributing to the goals set by the Action Agenda. The coordinator ensures cooperation with other AEGEE bodies and locals and reports on the team's progress.

The Working Group coordinator also organises at least one Live Meeting where the team can work on their activity plan and work on teambuilding.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator Equal Rights Working Group

profile_positions.description:
The Policy Officer is responsible for:
- Monitoring the external and internal news related to equal rigths.
- Informing the Network about the external happenings related to equal rights and starting discussions about it within the Network.
- Gathering the general opinion of the Network and developing the position of AEGEE, as well as writing shorter positions and opinions to react to external happenings related to equal rights.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer Equal Rights Working Group

profile_positions.description: The Civic Education working group works to create and implement activities to increase the civic competences of AEGEE members, and works to put Civic Education on the political agenda on all levels. It also performs tasks for AEGEE-Europe related to official positions on Civic Education and relevant research and representation.
profile_positions.title: Member Civic Education Working Group

profile_positions.description: The Subcommission works for a Network Commissioner as supportive staff. Subcommissioners get appointed one or two AEGEE locals and work closely with them and the Network Commissioner to ensure the wellbeing and development of this local. They also support te Netcom in organising the Network Meeting and support the development of the network.
profile_positions.title: Subcommissioner AEGEE-Europe

profile_positions.description:
The Equal Rights Conference lasted three days in May 2018 and was aimed at members of AEGEE-Europe with a special interest in LGBT+, gender and gender equality issues.

I was responsible for creating the schedule in cooperation with the content manager and the rest of the team. I worked to support the content manager with the recruiting of speakers, the creation of workshops and the faciliation of discussions. This also consisted of brainstorming about possible workshops, lectures and topics to include. Furthermore I recruited helpers and support staff and created their schedule. Finally I worked on promotion of the event and created promotional materials.
profile_positions.title: Member Organisation Equal Rights Conference

profile_positions.description:
This European Committee was mostly focused on organising a stop on the Europe on Track tour with the theme Sustainability and Climate Change. Hosting three ambassadors and cooperating with them in hosting several workshops and activities during their stop in Leiden.

The president of the committee oversees the team's work and internal relations, leads the team meetings and makes the agenda. The president also cooperates with the board-appointed member to ensure a fruitful relationship with the board of AEGEE-Leiden.
profile_positions.title: President European Committee

profile_positions.description:
AEGEE-Leiden is part of the European student forum AEGEE-Europe. AEGEE is one of Europe’s biggest interdisciplinary student organisations, striving for a democratic, diverse and borderless Europe. As a non-governmental, politically independent, and non-profit organisation AEGEE is open to students and young people from all faculties and disciplines. 

The European Affairs Officer is responsible for managing and coordinating the relationship between AEGEE-Leiden and the European network, as well as organizing European events in Leiden. My position as a board member allowed me to develop skills in teamwork, team management, event organisation, crisis management, cultivating professional relationships, and much more.
profile_positions.title: Board Member AEGEE-Leiden: European Affairs Officer

profile_positions.description: The board appointed member of the EC cooperates with the president of the committee with managing the team and the activities and is in charge of any external communnications necessary.
profile_positions.title: Board-appointed member European Committee

profile_positions.description:
The SU Committee is responsible for organising a Summer University. Summer Universities are events that take place in a lot of the cities where AEGEE is present. They focus on understanding and exploring the multicultural dimension of the European continent, tasting its diversity, removing national borders, fighting for tolerance and becoming open- minded citizens.

The board appointed member of the SU committee cooperates with the president of the committee with managing the team and the activities and is in charge of any external communnications necessary.
profile_positions.title: Board-Appointed member Summer University Committee

profile_positions.description: A Network Meeting is an event where AEGEE members come together to learn about different topics connected with the work of AEGEE. Network Meetings consist of a variety of activities such as sharing best practisces, workshops on e.g. project management, public relations, fundraising, presentation skills, and discussions concerning current youth issues. The organising local works with the Network Commission and is responsible for the logistical side of the events like arranging locations, food, helpers and social program.
profile_positions.title: Board-appointed member Network Meeting Commttee

profile_positions.description: Working with a team to create a 3-year plan for AEGEE-Leiden and to ensure the progress of the organisation.
profile_positions.title: Member Strategic Plan Team

profile_positions.description: The AEGEE-Leiden European Committee was responsible for helping the European Affairs Officer raise awareness about the possibilities within the AEGEE-Europe network and organising content-related activities to promote the thematic Focus Areas of AEGEE. It organises more 'serious' activities (like lectures, debates and workshops) as opposed to the party-related activities other committees organise.
profile_positions.title: Member European Committee

volunteer_experiences.description:
Counselor children's team at a summer camp for refugees, organized by NIVON.

Responsibilities include: 
- organising and overseeing activities for the children
- overseeing cooking/clean up 
- managing children's general welfare
